sentences.zh: 言上不明，暗昧蔽惑，則不能知善惡，親近習，長同類，亡功者受賞，有罪者不殺，百官廢亂，失在舒緩，故其咎舒也。

sentences.zh: 溫奧生蟲，故有蠃蟲之孽，謂螟螣之類當死不死，未當生而生，或多於故而為災也。

sentences.zh: 史記曰，秦武王三年渭水赤者三日，昭王三十四年渭水又赤三日。

translations.literal: Historical Records says: Qin Wu King third year Wei water red for three days, Zhao King thirty-fourth year Wei water again red three days.
translations.idiomatic: The Historical Records states: In the third year of Qin's King Wu, the Wei River ran red for three days. In the thirty-fourth year of King Zhao, the Wei River ran red again for three days.

sentences.zh: 劉向以為近火沴水也。

translations.literal: Liu Xiang considered it fire harming water nearby.
translations.idiomatic: Liu Xiang interpreted this as fire harming water in its vicinity.

sentences.zh: 秦連相坐之法，棄灰於道者黥，罔密而刑虐，加以武伐橫出，殘賊鄰國，至於變亂五行，氣色謬亂。

translations.literal: Qin had the law of mutual responsibility for crimes, discarding ashes on the road led to tattooing, the net was dense and punishments cruel, moreover military campaigns went out horizontally, injuring and destroying neighboring countries, reaching the point of changing and confusing the five elements, vital energy and colors in disorder.
translations.idiomatic: Qin had the system of mutual responsibility for crimes - even discarding ashes on the road led to tattooing as punishment. The legal net was dense and punishments cruel. Moreover, military campaigns were launched recklessly, injuring and destroying neighboring countries. This reached the point of disrupting the five elements, causing vital energy and colors to become disordered.

sentences.zh: 天戒若曰，勿為刻急，將致敗亡。

translations.literal: 天戒若曰，勿為刻急，將致敗亡。
translations.idiomatic: 天戒若曰，勿為刻急，將致敗亡。

translations.idiomatic: 秦遂不改，至始皇滅六國，二世而亡。

sentences.zh: 昔三代居三河，河洛出圖書，秦居渭陽，而渭水數赤，瑞異應德之效也。
